clinical_study.brief_title: tDCS Effects on GABA Concentration and Brain Functional Connectivity in Older Adults Of Working Age
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Transcranial Direct Current Stimulation (tDCS) on GABA Concentration and Brain Functional Connectivity in Older Adults.

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to investigate whether anodal tDCS over the left M1 leads to a decrease of GABA concentration and alterations of functional brain connectivity in older people, compared to sham tDCS.

primary_outcome.measure: GABA concentration assessed by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS) before and after anodal tDCS adjusted for baseline levels
primary_outcome.time_frame: assessed immediately before and after a 15-min stimulation time
primary_outcome.description: Investigation whether anodal tDCS leads to a significant reduction of M1-GABA concentration in older adults compared to sham stimulation.

secondary_outcome.measure: GABA concentration assessed by MRS before and after cathodal tDCS adjusted for baseline levels
secondary_outcome.time_frame: assessed immediately before and after a 15-min stimulation time
secondary_outcome.description: To assess stimulation effects on GABA concentration by magnetic resonance spectroscopy are measured before and after cathodal tDCS.
Functional connectivity as measured by resting-state fMRI during tDCS compared to sham
To assess predictors of positive reaction to brain stimulation, genotyping of several learning related polymorphisms will be performed.

arm_group.description: Anodal stimulation during resting state fMRI
Cathodal stimulation during resting state fMRI
Sham stimulation during resting state fMRI

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- unobtrusive neuropsychological screening
- age: older adults of working age: 50-65 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- Mild cognitive impairment (MCI) or other neurological diseases.
- History of severe alcoholism or use of drugs.
- Severe psychiatric disorders such as depression, psychosis (if not in remission) and severe untreated medical problems.
- Contraindication for MRI (claustrophobia, metallic implants, ferromagnetic metals in the body, disorders of thermoregulation, pregnant women).
